alert.note: Alert for Western Greenbrier (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 12:30PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Greenbrier County through 130 PM EDT... At 1228 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Bingham, or near Babcock State Park, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, pea size hail and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Rainelle... Rupert... Quinwood... Bingham... Trout... Meadow Bluff... and Duo. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
